wikipedia_page.main: John Edward Augustus Riggs Miller (1770 – 2 August 1825) was an English first-class cricketer with amateur status who was active in the 1790s playing for Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC). He is recorded in one first-class match in 1791, playing for an Old Etonians XI and totalling 9 runs with a highest score of 9.Miller was born in Paris, the son of Sir John Riggs Miller and his wife Anna, Lady Miller. He succeeded to his father's baronetcy in May 1798.
